title: Ticket #3081: Disable transfer of output files
description:
When debugging an issue with Condor-CE, we noticed there was no user-friendly way to specify that output files in the sandbox should not be transferred back to the submit host.

We hit this when moving submitters from GT2 (where only explicitly listed files and stdout/err are transferred) to Condor-C (where all files in the sandbox are transferred); blahp will create copies of the proxy in the working directory, which is transferred back to the submitter Iwd.

The solution Jaime came up with was adding 

+TransferOutput=""

This is not intuitive or user-friendly. There should be something along the lines of "auto_detect_output=False" as a first-class option to condor_submit.
remarks:
2013-Jan-15 13:47:59 by matt:
Intuitive for me would be: when_to_transfer_output = NEVER

auto_detect_output = FALSE suggest the user knows something about how output is selected for retrieval.

2013-Jan-18 09:49:36 by jfrey:
With when_to_transfer_output = NEVER, how do you tell Condor to transfer the stdout and stderr, but no other output files?

2014-Feb-25 11:22:16 by bbockelm:
Hi Jaime,

What's your thoughts on this one?

Brian

2017-Jul-27 10:35:18 by jfrey:
Condor_submit now supports the following: 
transfer_output_files = ""

This disables all output transfer other than stdout and stderr, whose transfer can already be disabled via other attributes. See ticket #5159.
creator: bbockelm
